result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th).207. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th).207 was dismissed by the court.

  • Joshua D. DeMeyer was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:31 p.m. Defendant Joshua D. DeMeyer in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cirilli states agreement. State moves to dismiss Count 2 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Pfeifer/Cirilli/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 3 years
Fine - $5000
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Jail - 6 months with Huber for all purposes. May serve in Columbia County. To commence on/before October 16, 2016 at 8:00 a.m. 
Jail credit - 6 days
Driver's License revoked - 36 months
IID - 36 months

Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.

1:35 p.m. Defendant Joshua D. DeMeyer in court with attorney Michael John Rielly. Jodie L. Bednar, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Officer Brian Colombino, sworn, direct. Witness identifies defendant. State's Exh. 1 (Lab results) marked, offered, received. State's Exh. 2 (Blood draw form) marked, offered, received. Cross by Rielly; questioned by the Court. Court finds probable cause exists and binds defendant over for trial. Rielly in receipt of Information; defendant pleads not guilty. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

3:05 p.m. Defendant Joshua D. DeMeyer in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Off record. 3:06 p.m.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued. Adj. 3:07 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

2:19 p.m. Defendant Joshua D. DeMeyer in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he has spoken to Mike Rielly - is attempting to get retainer together - Court schedules another AIA but states will move forward on that with/without attorney. Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

1:52 p.m. Defendant Joshua D. DeMeyer in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes that defendant has posted cash bond; directs defendant to follow conditions of bond. Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 02:30 pm. Adj. 1:54 p.m.
